data.title: A Nice Surprise!
data.text: First, I got the "Unicorn." A white chocolate mocha w/blueberry. Sounded interesting . . . so I ordered a medium. Deee-licious . . . Next time I'll get a large! The grilled  veggie sandwich was very tasty . . . A super basil mayo added a lot of flavor.  This sandwich would rival the one we had at Huisache with more potobello and mote avacado. I indulged in a warmed-up cinnamon roll smothered with pecans & yellow raisins . . . Really good. Located right behind Chik-fil-a, which was closed on this Sunday morning!

data.title: Great place for a quiet breakfast.
data.text: The location with right in the heart of New Braunfels.  Small space with seating inside and outside.  They have great kolaches, breakfast tacos, muffins, pastries, etc.  Our group came about an hour before noon and and catch a quick breakfast.  Ordered and got our orders pretty fast.  Nice little place that I'll remember next time I'm in New Braunfels.

data.title: Good coffee and quick eats
data.text: Overall good quick eats, breakfast taco and tomato soup are excellent, small place in a downtown setting with a few tables outside

data.title: Refuge from the rain
data.text: Stopped in to get out of the rain. Had a great cappuccino and a triple chocalate cake to die for. Friendly and welcomming. Will definitely revisit.

data.title: Good cup of coffee
data.text: I like supporting local coffee shops over the big boys.  This place is casual and friendly.  I drive through usually.  I have had their breakfast and it's good.  Wifi is kind of weak.  They need to bring in some live muzak on Sunday mornings.  Maybe a comfy couch

data.title: Buy Local
data.text: Great place to get coffee and light breakfast/lunch. My visit was pleasant, and the coffee and breakfast was pretty good.

data.title: Small Place - Great Sandwiches
data.text:
Great location.  Right in town square.   A view of the gazebo if you sit outside.  Kind of a small place.  Maybe 20 seats.  Decor is so-so.  One standard height table. Some mid-high tables. And a few counter height seats.

The sandwiches were fresh and delicious!  Prices were reasonable and competitive.  Worth another trip in spite of the following service drawbacks.

Music was a bit loud for our taste.

Clerk did not offer a receipt and I forgot to ask.

My wife asked for tomatoes on side, but she didn't get them.

I asked for their raspberry iced tea, but it tasted like regular.  If it was raspberry, they short-changed the flavoring, big time.

Online menu says: "Roast Beef says Served hot, sliced thin & piled high!"  
I understand "piled high" is undefined. but was a bit disappointed in the amount of roast beef on the sandwich--only because of the menu claim.

Yes, will visit there again.  

There is another location out past the 337 Loop.  Not sure if same ownership or not.

(Sorry, forgot to take a photo)
